text.title: Scotland Politics | Latest News & Updates | BBC News
text.text: Scotland Politics | Latest News & Updates | BBC News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News Scotland Scotland Politics LIVE Grooming gangs inquiry demand and state of NHS raised at FMQs John Swinney is grilled by opposition party leaders during First Minister's Questions Is Scottish Labour on the brink of Westminster revolt? The prime minister is set to visit Scotland later, but there are murmurings of discontent among his MPs. 7 hrs ago Scotland Politics Scottish government orders review of grooming gangs evidence The review will inform a future decision on whether or not there should be a judge-led public inquiry. 20 hrs ago Scotland Politics Reeves should resign for misleading public, says Swinney The first minister has called for the chancellor to step down due to comments she made ahead of the Budget. 3 days ago Scotland Politics Flu cases in Scotland more than double in a week In the week of 24-30 November, lab-confirmed cases rose from 845 to 1,759, according to Public Health Scotland data. 2 hrs ago Scotland Politics Seven health boards given £230m bailout loans despite record funding Despite record levels of NHS funding, seven health boards needed government help to balance their books last year. 7 hrs ago Scotland GB Energy plan to focus on historical oil and gas areas The new publicly-owned body says its investments will aim to support 10,000 jobs by 2030. 7 hrs ago Scotland Business Should football fans be banned from games for using pyrotechnics? The Scottish government is seeking views on whether banning orders should be given out for the use of flares or fireworks at matches. Health secretary insists there is enough stock of flu vaccine Over a million adults and 400,000 children received the flu jab between September and November. Sandie Peggie lawyer says Scottish government is in denial Lawyer Naomi Cunningham says the Supreme Court judgment is "a model of clarity and simplicity". MSPs pass emergency bill to fix business rates blunder The government is seeking to correct a legislative error in a bid to avoid a £400m bill to refund taxpayers. No changes to Scottish income tax plan, Robison says The finance secretary says rates will not rise and no new bands will be introduced in January's Budget. Features and analysis The SQA has been scrapped. Why and what now? Qualifications Scotland comes into being on Tuesday but is it any more than a rebranding of the existing exams agency? 'I would love to be doing this in my 60s' - the debate over selling sex in Scotland Porcelain Victoria is concerned that a potential change in law in Scotland could drive sex workers into poverty. What difference could bonds make to funding a future Scotland? Scottish ministers are to issue bonds for the first time but is that the best way for a country to borrow money? Budget 2025: Key points at a glance Changes to tax, pensions and welfare - here’s what you need to know from Rachel Reevesher second Budget. How Scottish parties will try to maximise election votes in six months Opinion polls point to a fifth SNP victory - but a lot could change in six months with parties working flat out for votes. text.clean_text: News News Scotland Scotland Politics LIVE Grooming gangs inquiry demand and state of NHS raised at FMQs John Swinney is grilled by opposition party leaders during First Minister's Questions Is Scottish Labour on the brink of Westminster revolt? The prime minister is set to visit Scotland later, but there are murmurings of discontent among his MPs. 7 hrs ago Scotland Politics Scottish government orders review of grooming gangs evidence The review will inform a future decision on whether or not there should be a judge-led public inquiry. 20 hrs ago Scotland Politics Reeves should resign for misleading public, says Swinney The first minister has called for the chancellor to step down due to comments she made ahead of the Budget. 3 days ago Scotland Politics Flu cases in Scotland more than double in a week In the week of 24-30 November, lab-confirmed cases rose from 845 to 1,759, according to Public Health Scotland data. 2 hrs ago Scotland Politics Seven health boards given £230m bailout loans despite record funding Despite record levels of NHS funding, seven health boards needed government help to balance their books last year. 7 hrs ago Scotland GB Energy plan to focus on historical oil and gas areas The new publicly-owned body says its investments will aim to support 10,000 jobs by 2030. 7 hrs ago Scotland Business Should football fans be banned from games for using pyrotechnics? The Scottish government is seeking views on whether banning orders should be given out for the use of flares or fireworks at matches. Health secretary insists there is enough stock of flu vaccine Over a million adults and 400,000 children received the flu jab between September and November. Sandie Peggie lawyer says Scottish government is in denial Lawyer Naomi Cunningham says the Supreme Court judgment is "a model of clarity and simplicity". MSPs pass emergency bill to fix business rates blunder The government is seeking to correct a legislative error in a bid to avoid a £400m bill to refund taxpayers. No changes to Scottish income tax plan, Robison says The finance secretary says rates will not rise and no new bands will be introduced in January's Budget. Features and analysis The SQA has been scrapped. Why and what now? Qualifications Scotland comes into being on Tuesday but is it any more than a rebranding of the existing exams agency? 'I would love to be doing this in my 60s' - the debate over selling sex in Scotland Porcelain Victoria is concerned that a potential change in law in Scotland could drive sex workers into poverty. What difference could bonds make to funding a future Scotland? Scottish ministers are to issue bonds for the first time but is that the best way for a country to borrow money? How Scottish parties will try to maximise election votes in six months Opinion polls point to a fifth SNP victory - but a lot could change in six months with parties working flat out for votes.
